DOC.brief_summary: Obstructive sleep apnoea ( OSA ) common medical problem , despite increase awareness , remain under-diagnosed . There close association OSA obesity ; 60-70 % patient diagnose OSA either obese overweight [ 1 ] . OSA also common among patient type 2 diabetes . Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus ( T2DM ) reach epidemic status Gulf region . OSA worsen insulin resistance lead weight gain sleep disturbance [ 2 ] . Several mechanism propose association OSA diabetes obesity [ 3 ] . At present little available information regard prevalence OSA UAE , relationship T2DM obesity , impact OSA health outcome Emirati population . This research explore relationships inform public health decision regard diagnostic pathway , service provision treatment protocol .
DOC.brief_title: Abu Dhabi Sleep Apnea ( ADSA ) Study
DOC.criteria: Participants age 1864 year old . Both Gender male female . Paediatrics age 18 . Any participant unable take part
